outline.text: The Credit Union National Association (CUNA) appreciates the opportunity to
comment on the proposed rule regarding the public disclosure of penalties that
impased by the Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC), which appeared in
Registeron June 19,2002. CUNA represents more than 90 percent
of our nation's 10,500 state and federal credit unions.

If OFAC proceeds with this rule regarding the public disclosure of penalties, we
suggest that OFAC provide the affected parties a period of time, such as ninety
days or more, so that they can correct the violation in order to avoid public
disclosure. If the disclosure would still have to be
time would also provide these entities with a reasonable opportunity to advise
their members or customers of the circumstances of the situation and to
persuade them not to take actions to alter their relationships with the institution.
Thank you for the opportunity to comment on the proposed rule regarding the
public disclosure of OFAC penalties. If you or other staff have questions about
